chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Lue Moua was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samuel Lue Moua is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samuel Lue Moua was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Samuel Lue Moua was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Samuel Lue Moua was found guilty of Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation by the end of day on 5/20/22.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs. Payable through Clerk of Court.
- $250 DNA Surcharge. Payable through Clerk of Court.
- AODA within 30 days and follow through with recommendations.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license or Ignition Interlock Device.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's.

01:10 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Christianson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Samuel Lue Moua appeared. Court reviews case. ADA Becker recites resolution. DE Sworn. WOPH: Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.Court questions Defendant. Proceed to PLEAS: Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 1: Bail Jump- 946.4991)(b), Count 3: Possession of TCH (2nd offense)-961.41(3g)(e), and Count 6: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order- 347.413(1). Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Count 2, 4,and 5. Sentencing arguments.  Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Status conference on February 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on February 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to drug and ETG testing prior to each court hearing he appears for. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

Defendant to test at St. Croix County Justice Support Center today (2/9/22) for drug and ETG testing.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
